meanings.definition: Persuade someone to do something by sustained coaxing or flattery.
meanings.sent1: She tried to cajole her friend into sharing the last piece of cake.
meanings.sent2: The salesman attempted to cajole the customer into buying the expensive watch.
meanings.sent3: The puppy tried to cajole the cat into playing by wagging its tail.
meanings.sent4: The magician cajoled the audience into believing he could make the rabbit disappear.
meanings.sent5: The teacher cajoled the students into participating by offering a reward.

meanings.definition: Influence or urge by gentle urging, caressing, or flattering.
meanings.sent1: He managed to cajole his sister into letting him borrow her bike.
meanings.sent2: The mother cajoled her child to eat vegetables by making it a game.
meanings.sent3: The cat cajoled its owner into giving it extra treats by purring loudly.
meanings.sent4: The sun cajoled the flowers to bloom with its warm rays.
meanings.sent5: The music cajoled the audience into dancing with its lively beat.
